event.summary: 10/07/1993: According to authorities, the urban militias of the 22nd Front of the FARC were responsible for detonating a remote-controlled bomb against the headquarters of a National political party. A National Police bus and the National Civil Registry office were targeted in separate incidents.
event.target1: A campaign office of liberal presidential candidate Ernest Sampe
event.propcomment: Between the three related attacks (cf.1993100701/3) damages were estimated at 200 million pesos.
event.addnotes: This was one of three related attacks (cf. 199310070001; 199310070003).
event.scite1: "Authorities (sic) Blame Leftist Rebels for Bogota Terrorism," The Associated Press Worldstream, October 8, 1993.
event.scite2: Columbia Examining Anti-Rebel Measures in Wake of Police Bus Bombing,” United Press International, October 8, 1993.
event.scite3: "Minster Blames FARC for Bogota Bomb Attacks which Kill Two Policeman,” The British Broadcasting Corporation, October 11, 1993.
